members.name: align
members.description: The alignment of the content within the column.

members.name: autoWidth
members.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

members.name: columnUpdateEvent
members.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

members.name: columns
members.description: The nested columns in the group.

members.name: grid
members.description: The parent grid instance.

members.name: grow
members.description:
The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.
A ratio of 0 means the column width is fixed.

members.name: header
members.description: The label for the column header.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: parts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the value for this column.

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

members.name: scopedElements
members.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: stateChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.name: width
members.description: The width of the group column is either manually specified, or the sum of the nested columns.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

members.name: columnUpdateEvent
members.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

members.name: filter
members.description: The filter function if you want to do custom filtering.

members.name: grid
members.description: The parent grid instance.

members.name: grow
members.description:
The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.
A ratio of 0 means the column width is fixed.

members.name: header
members.description: The label for the column header.

members.name: internalOptions
members.description: The internal options if none are provided.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: mode
members.description:
The mode for the filter:
- `select`: The filter will allow you to select from a list of options. If none
are provided, the filter will create a list of options based on the column's values
- `text`: The filter will be a text field.

members.name: options
members.description:
The options you can choose from to filter. If not provided,
the filter will be a text field.

members.name: parts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the value for this column.

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

members.name: scopedElements
members.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: stateChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.name: value
members.description: The value for this filter column.

members.name: width
members.description: Width of the cells for this column in pixels.

- `text`: The filter will be a text field.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode of the filter.

attributes.description: The path to the field to filter on.

fields.name: #value
fields.description: The filter value(s).

fields.name: column
fields.description: The grid column.

fields.name: filter
fields.description: The custom filter

fields.name: filterChangeEvent
fields.description: Emits when the filter has been added or removed.

fields.name: filterValueChangeEvent
fields.description: Emits when the value of the this filter has changed.

fields.name: options
fields.description: The filter options.

members.name: activeItem
members.description: The active item in the grid.

members.name: activeItemChangeEvent
members.description: Emits when the active item changes

members.name: dataSource
members.description: Provide your own implementation for getting the data.

members.name: dragEndEvent
members.description: Emits when a drag operation has finished.

members.name: dragStartEvent
members.description: Emits when a drag operation is starting.

members.name: draggableRows
members.description:
Whether you can drag rows in the grid. If you use the drag-handle column,
then this property is automatically set by the column to 'between'.

members.name: dropEvent
members.description: Emits when an item has been dropped.

members.name: dropFilter
members.description:
Determines if or what kind of drop target the given item is:
- boolean: the item is valid drop target based on the draggableRows value
- 'between': the item is a valid drop target between
- 'on-top': the item is a valid drop target to drop on top of

members.name: itemParts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<tr>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: items
members.description: An array of items to be displayed in the grid.

members.name: itemsGroupBy
members.description: The path to the attribute to group the items on.

members.name: noBorder
members.description: Hide the border around the grid when true.

members.name: noRowBorder
members.description: Hides the border between rows when true.

members.name: recalculateColumnWidths
members.description: Updates the `width` of all columns which have `autoWidth` set to `true`.

members.name: selection
members.description: Selection manager.

members.name: stateChangeEvent
members.description: Emits when the state in the grid has changed.

members.name: striped
members.description: Uses alternating background colors for the rows when set.

members.name: tbody
members.description: The `<tbody>` element.

members.name: thead
members.description: The `<thead>` element.

members.name: view
members.description: The model used for rendering the grid.

attributes.name: draggable-rows
attributes.description:
Whether you can drag rows in the grid. If you use the drag-handle column,
then this property is automatically set by the column to 'between'.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: An array of items to be displayed in the grid.

attributes.name: items-group-by
attributes.description: The path to the attribute to group the items on.

attributes.name: no-border
attributes.description: Hide the border around the grid when true.

attributes.name: no-row-border
attributes.description: Hides the border between rows when true.

attributes.name: striped
attributes.description: Uses alternating background colors for the rows when set.

methods.name: recalculateColumnWidths
methods.description: Updates the `width` of all columns which have `autoWidth` set to `true`.

fields.name: #dragItem
fields.description: The item being dragged.

fields.name: #dropPlaceholder
fields.description: The placeholder element where the drag item will be dropped.

fields.name: #dropTargetMode
fields.description: The mode if the drag item is dropped on the current target.

fields.name: #filters
fields.description: The filters for this grid.

fields.name: #initialColumnWidthsCalculated
fields.description: Flag for calculating the column widths only once.

fields.name: #mutationObserver
fields.description: Observe the tbody style changes.

fields.name: #resizeObserver
fields.description: Observe the grid width.

fields.name: #sorters
fields.description: The sorters for this grid.

Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

fields.name: columnUpdateEvent
fields.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

fields.name: grid
fields.description: The parent grid instance.

fields.name: renderer
fields.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

fields.name: scopedElements
fields.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: align
members.description: The alignment of the content within the column.

members.name: autoSelect
members.description: When true, the active rows get selected automatically.

members.name: autoWidth
members.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `grow` is not 0.

members.name: columnUpdateEvent
members.description: Emits when the column definition has changed.

members.name: grid
members.description: The parent grid instance.

members.name: grow
members.description:
The ratio with which the column will grow relative to the other columns.
A ratio of 0 means the column width is fixed.

members.name: header
members.description: The label for the column header.

members.name: itemsChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

members.name: parts
members.description: Custom parts to be set on the `<td>` so it can be styled externally.

members.name: path
members.description: The path to the value for this column.

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer function for the column value of each cell.

members.name: scopedElements
members.description:
The custom elements used for rendering this column. Since the rendering the column cells is done
in the parent grid component, the custom elements need to be registered in the parent grid.

members.name: selectAll
members.description: When true, all items are selected.

members.name: stateChanged
members.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: sticky
members.description: Whether this column is sticky when the user scrolls horizontally.

members.name: width
members.description: Width of the cells for this column in pixels.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when

methods.name: itemsChanged
methods.description:
This method is called when the contents of the grid has changed.
This happens when the items property is directly set or when the data source has changed.

methods.description:
This method is called when the state of the grid has changed.
This happens for examples when a filter or sorting changes.

members.name: columnDefinitions
members.description: Sets the available columns. Not all columns may be rendered, depending on the view state.

members.name: columns
members.description: Returns an array of visible columns.

members.name: getGroupSelection
members.description: Returns the selected state of the group.

members.name: getGroupState
members.description: Returns true if the group is expanded, false if collapsed.

members.name: getStickyColumnOffset
members.description: Returns the left offset, taking any sticky columns into account.

members.name: toggleColumn
members.description: Toggle the visibility of the column.

members.name: toggleGroup
members.description: Toggle the visibility of the group.

methods.name: toggleColumn
methods.description: Toggle the visibility of the column.

methods.name: toggleGroup
methods.description: Toggle the visibility of the group.

methods.name: getGroupSelection
methods.description: Returns the selected state of the group.

methods.name: getGroupState
methods.description: Returns true if the group is expanded, false if collapsed.

methods.name: getStickyColumnOffset
methods.description: Returns the left offset, taking any sticky columns into account.

fields.name: columns
fields.description: Returns an array of visible columns.
